text: (What's the Story) Morning Glory? is the second album by the rock band Oasis. It was released in October 1995. The album was Oasis's highest selling album. It charted number one in the United Kingdom (staying there for 10 weeks) and number four in the U.S. The album sold 346,000 copies in its first week in the United Kingdom.Harris, p. 254 It has sold around 23 million copies worldwide, but several sources say that it has sold over 30 million. It is the third biggest-selling album in UK chart history (with 4.4 million copies sold). The album was the second biggest selling album for both 1995 and 1996 in the UK. It became the biggest selling album of the decade. The album has gone 4Ã— platinum (3.9 million copies) in the United States.Trust, Gary. "Ask Billboard: "English Beat". billboard.com. 23 January 2009. Album singles "Some Might Say", "Roll with It", "Wonderwall" and "Don't Look Back in Anger" were big hits in the UK, with "Some Might Say" and "Don't Look Back in Anger" both reaching the number one spot in the UK singles chart. "Wonderwall" and "Champagne Supernova" both reached #1 on the U.S. Modern Rock Tracks chart. They would go on to be certified gold in the United States. whilst "Wonderwall" also was at the top of the Australian ARIA charts. The album won Best British Album at the 1996 BRIT Awards, and won the BRIT Award for the best British Album of the last 30 Years at the 2010 BRIT Awards. == Chart positions == Year Chart Peak 1995 UK Albums Chart 1 1995 U.S. Billboard 200Oasis > Charts & Awards > Billboard Albums 4 1996 Australian ARIA Albums Chart 1 1996 New Zealand Albums Chart 1 1996 Spanish Albums Chart 1 == References == Category:1995 albums Category:Oasis (band) albums
title: (What's the Story) Morning Glory?
